src:
Mcgregor dømt for vold
MMA-stjernen Conor McGregor må betale en bot på 1000 euro for å ha slått til en mann på en pub.
01 Nov 2019, 16:40 by NTB I
31-åringen innrømmet skyld da han fredag møtte i retten i Dublin. McGregor sa videre at det han hadde gjort var «helt feil», og han lovet til dommeren at noe lignende ikke vil skje igjen.
Under rettshøringen ble det vist video av hendelsen som skjedde i april i år.

Iren må betale 1000 euro, tilsvarende cirka 10.200 kroner i bot for episoden.

McGregor har ikke vært i ringen siden oktober 2018.
Da tapte han mot Khabib Nurmagomedov. Iren ble senere utestengt i seks måneder for slåssing etter oppgjøret.
Nå er det ventet at han er tilbake i oktogonen i januar. Motstanderen er foreløpig ukjent.
text:
Mcgregor convicted of violence
MMA star Conor McGregor has to pay a fine of 1000 euros for hitting a man in a pub.
01 Nov 2019, 16:40 by NTB I
The 31-year-old admitted guilt when he appeared in court in Dublin on Friday. McGregor further said that what he had done was "completely wrong" and he promised the judge that something similar would not happen again.
During the hearing, a video of the incident happened in April this year.

The Irish have to pay 1000 euros, corresponding to about NOK 10,200 in fine for the episode.

McGregor has not been in the ring since October 2018.
Then he lost to Khabib Nurmagomedov. The Irishman was later banned for six months for fighting after the settlement.
Now he is expected to be back in the Octagon in January. The opponent is currently unknown.
